description.narrative: Projektet syftar till att bidra till utvecklingsprocessen i Guatemala, inom ramen för UNDPs program och planering, med analys, information och kunskapsgenerering, genom ett perspektiv på mänsklig utveckling, som främjar debatt om definitionen av offentlig politik och åtgärder för att förbättra livskvaliteten, minska fattgdomen och öka den social harmonin i Guatemala. Projektet avser att verka inom tre huvudområden: 1. Produktion av en "Human Development Report" som publiceras under första kvartalet 2015 tillsammans med andra produkter av kunskapsrelaterad karaktär. 2. Genom en medborgarundersökning inhämta och analysera information om attityder till utveckling och kapacitet för social harmoni i Guatemala. 3. Verka för att de rekommendationer som utvecklats genom strategiska allianser mellan olika aktörer, tjämstemän och beslutsfattare inom ramen för UNDP:s program och kommunikationsprocesser följs.

The project aims to contribute to the development process of the country, within the framework of the UNDP program, with analysis, information and knowledge generation, under the human development approach, that foster debate on the definition of public policies and actions to improve the quality of life and social peace of Guatemalan citizenship. The project is proposed to work in three major areas: 1. Production of a Human Development Report to be published in the first quarter of 2015 and other products of knowledge. 2. Obtaining information about attitudes towards the process of development and capacities for social harmony, through a citizen survey. 3. Compliance with the recommendations expressed through strategic alliances with officials and decision makers in UNDP program framework and communication processes.

The Guatemalan state has strenghtened its institutional capacity to formulate and implement policies and strategies in regards of human development, poverty reduction and obtaining the Millenium Development Goals.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The principal objectives of the Human Development Report 2014/2015 were to produce a Report, collect information on citizen perception of social harmony and wellbeing, and an advoccy campaign for implementing the recommendations generated by the Report. With some delay due to political context of the country during the investigative phase (2015), the Report succeeded in raising interest and discussion on the structural and persistent racism, inequalities and poverty in Guatemala. Report findings were officially presented in October 2016 and disseminated among a wide variety of national actors, including government authorities, private sector (extractive businesses), academia, civil society organizations, the press, donor community, and the judiciary where report data may be used to back-up and justify sentencing, for example in transitional justice cases. Through the citizen survey, the IDH team was able to produce new information on the understanding of the main problems affecting citizens wellbeing, focusing on its non-material aspects. This alternative measuring method and analysis to understand wellbeing takes into consideration the fact that there are different opinions on what constitutes 'development' based on distinct factors, among them cultural context of the person, which need to be taken into account when designing public policy. IDH team, based on the Report and the analysis, has supported the design of strategic plans and country evaluations of UNDP programs; supported UNDAF and formulation of UNPD Strategic Plan; assisted the design of multidimensional poverty measuring methdology of private business linked to CentraRse to establish a poverty-reduction program for workers. IDH team has also contributed to creation and analysis of millenium development objective indicators in Guatemala.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
